de.avgl.dmp.converter.pipe

Class StreamJsonCollapser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.culturegraph.mf.framework.DefaultSender<R>
      • org.culturegraph.mf.framework.DefaultStreamPipe<org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver>
        • de.avgl.dmp.converter.pipe.StreamJsonCollapser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.culturegraph.mf.framework.LifeCycle, org.culturegraph.mf.framework.Sender<org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver>, org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamPipe<org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver>, org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver

    public class StreamJsonCollapser
extends org.culturegraph.mf.framework.DefaultStreamPipe<org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver>
    Collapse several literals of the same name within on entity in such a way, that a following JsonEncoder will produce correct results.
    Author:
    Paul Horn

      • literal

        public void literal(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String value)
        Groups literals within the same entity by their name. Instead of directly forwarding every literal, they are buffered in a LinkedListMultimap. Subsequent calls to endEntity() or endRecord() will flush the buffered value. If some name appeared multiple times, it will result in a new array entity.
        Specified by:
        literal in interface org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver
        Overrides:
        literal in class org.culturegraph.mf.framework.DefaultStreamPipe<org.culturegraph.mf.framework.StreamReceiver>
        Parameters:
        name - literal name (may appear multiple times)
        value - literal value
